meanings.sent1: The preemergence stage of a butterfly is when it is still in its cocoon.
meanings.sent2: The preemergence frost warning was issued to protect the delicate plants.
meanings.sent3: The preemergence surprise party was a success, catching the birthday girl off guard.
meanings.sent4: The preemergence excitement in the air was palpable as the crowd awaited the grand reveal.
meanings.sent5: The preemergence anticipation of the new movie release had fans lining up outside the theater.

meanings.definition: The state of being before emergence
meanings.sent1: The preemergence of the seed was crucial for its successful growth.
meanings.sent2: The preemergence of the sun marked the beginning of a new day.
meanings.sent3: The preemergence of the rare flower drew in many curious onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The preemergence of talent in the young artist was evident from a very early age.
meanings.sent5: The preemergence of technology has revolutionized the way we communicate.

meanings.definition: A substance applied to soil to prevent weed growth before plants emerge
meanings.sent1: The preemergence was carefully spread across the garden to protect the crops.
meanings.sent2: The preemergence application helped maintain a weed-free garden throughout the season.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the preemergence for food and scattered it around.
meanings.sent4: The preemergence acted as a shield, safeguarding the young plants from invasive weeds.
meanings.sent5: The effectiveness of the preemergence in controlling weed growth was evident in the flourishing garden.
